name: GetWebinarParticipantReport
description:
Retrieve detailed report on webinar attendees.

Fetches a comprehensive report of each participant in a specified webinar from the last 6 months. Requires a Pro or higher plan with Webinar add-on enabled. Suitable for fetching participant data when analyzing webinar attendance and engagement.

parameters.name: webinar_identifier
parameters.description: The webinar's ID or UUID. Double-encode UUIDs starting with '/' or containing '//'.

value_schema.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the webinar UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: number_of_records_per_call
parameters.description: Specifies the number of records to return in a single API call for webinar participant reports.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for paginating through large sets of webinar participant data. Expires in 15 minutes.

value_schema.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: include_registrant_id
parameters.description: Specify if the registrant's unique ID should be included in the webinar participant report.

value_schema.description:
The additional query parameters to include. 
* `registrant_id` - Include the registrant's ID in the API response. The registrant ID is the webinar participant's unique ID.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Zoom Meetings API.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

value_schema.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

value_schema.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: include_fields
parameters.description:
The additional query parameters to include. 
* `registrant_id` - Include the registrant's ID in the API response. The registrant ID is the webinar participant's unique ID.

value_schema.description:
The additional query parameters to include. 
* `registrant_id` - Include the registrant's ID in the API response. The registrant ID is the webinar participant's unique ID.

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the webinar UUID before making an API request.

value_schema.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the webinar UUID before making an API request.
